üí∞ Markets & Economy.title: RBI may need to inject further '2 lakh crore to let rates transmit
üí∞ Markets & Economy.summary: To ensure the recent interest rate reduction truly benefits the economy, the Reserve Bank of India may have to infuse a staggering 1.5 lakh crore into the financial system. This move is seen as vital to offset the liquidity drains caused by advance tax payments and possible forex market interventions.

üí∞ Markets & Economy.title: Budget 2026: States may get bigger capex push as Centre plans higher interest-free loans
üí∞ Markets & Economy.summary: The allocation under the Special Assistance to States for Capital Investment (SASCI) scheme may be raised to Rs 1.8-2 lakh crore for 2026-27 from Rs 1.5 lakh crore budgeted for the current fiscal.

üí∞ Markets & Economy.title: Gold imports drive India's CAD to 1.3% in Q2 FY26: Analysts
üí∞ Markets & Economy.summary: According to assessments by Crisil, ICICI Bank Research and Emkay Global, the merchandise deficit expanded as gold imports surged nearly 150% quarter-on-quarter, touching USD 19 billion in Q2, while goods exports declined on a sequential basis following the rollout of higher US tariffs on Indian shipments.

üí∞ Markets & Economy.title: Uday Kotak urges Indian firms to step up as rupee crosses 90 and foreign investors dominate markets
üí∞ Markets & Economy.summary: The Indian Rupee is nearing 90 against the US Dollar. Foreign investors are selling Indian stocks, impacting market performance. Domestic investors are buying, but foreign selling is currently dominant. This situation calls for Indian businesses to adapt. Export-oriented sectors may benefit from the weaker Rupee, while import-dependent sectors face increased costs.

üí∞ Markets & Economy.title: Capex cuts to offset tax shortfalls, Govt on track for fiscal targets of FY26: Goldman Sachs
üí∞ Markets & Economy.summary: Goldman Sachs anticipates the central government will meet its FY26 fiscal deficit target of 4.4% of GDP by curtailing capital expenditure. This measure is expected to offset anticipated shortfalls in income tax and GST collections, despite a recent contraction in government capex.

üè≠ Industry News.title: Starlink says India pricing not announced after website glitch shows dummy data
üè≠ Industry News.summary: Starlink has clarified that it has not opened orders or revealed pricing for customers in India. A technical glitch briefly displayed incorrect internal test figures online, leading to speculation about subscription plans. The company is currently focused on obtaining final government approvals for service rollout.

üè≠ Industry News.title: Govt to curtail IndiGo's winter flight schedule, slots to be reallocated to other carriers: Aviation Min
üè≠ Industry News.summary: Civil Aviation Minister K Ram Mohan Naidu announced that IndiGo's winter flight schedule will be curtailed due to recent operational disruptions. The airline, currently operating 2,200 flights, will see a reduction in its routes.  Refunds totaling Rs 745 crore have been issued for over 7.3 lakh cancelled PNRs, and most delayed passenger bags have been delivered.

üè≠ Industry News.title: SC asks Delhi Metro to explain ‚Äòno-bid‚Äô contract to Indus Towers
üè≠ Industry News.summary: Crest Digital, one of the contenders for the work, has challenged DMRC‚Äôs decision to award the contract to Indus Towers on a nomination basis through private negotiations and without any competitive bidding.

üè≠ Industry News.title: "Things almost back to normal...": Civil Aviation Secretary on disruptions caused by Indigo crisis
üè≠ Industry News.summary: IndiGo crisis: Union Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu Kinjarapu told Rajya Sabha earlier in the day that the problems faced by Indigo Airlines passengers were linked to the airline's internal crew rostering and operational planning.

üè≠ Industry News.title: Larsen & Toubro to consolidate real estate business
üè≠ Industry News.summary: Larsen & Toubro is consolidating its real estate operations under L&T Realty Properties. This strategic move aims to create a unified entity to leverage India's real estate growth. The company will expand its project pipeline through land acquisitions and joint developments. This consolidation will bolster L&T Realty's position as a singular brand for real estate.

üíª Tech & Startups.title: PhysicsWallah increases stake in Utkarsh Classes to 76%
üíª Tech & Startups.summary: The infusion of Rs 26.5 crore is part of a February 2023 agreement, under which the edtech firm plans to gradually acquire full ownership of Utkarsh Classes by March 2028.

üíª Tech & Startups.title: PhysicsWallah posts 26% rise in Q2 FY26 revenue; profit climbs to Rs 70 crore
üíª Tech & Startups.summary: For the newly listed edtech startup, adjusted Ebitda margin rose to 26% in Q2 FY26 from 23% in the same period of the previous year on improved operating leverage.

üíª Tech & Startups.title: Massachusetts court hears arguments in lawsuit alleging Meta designed apps to be addictive to kids
üíª Tech & Startups.summary: The lawsuit, filed in 2024 by Attorney General Andrea Campbell, alleges that Meta did this to make a profit and that its actions affected hundreds of thousands of teenagers in Massachusetts who use the social media platforms.

üíª Tech & Startups.title: Apple chip chief tells staff he‚Äôs not leaving ‚Äòanytime soon‚Äô
üíª Tech & Startups.summary: Apple‚Äôs Johny Srouji, who oversees the company‚Äôs chip division, told staff that he‚Äôs staying at the iPhone maker.

üíª Tech & Startups.title: PhysicsWallah Q2 Results: Profit soars 62% YoY to Rs 72 crore, revenue surges 26%
üíª Tech & Startups.summary: PhysicsWallah reported 62% YoY profit growth and 26% revenue rise in Q2, backed by rapid offline expansion, diversified income streams, and improved margins following major cost optimisation and strong post-IPO growth momentum.

üáÆüá≥ Politics & Nation.title: IndiGo crisis: Aviation min answerable to Parliament, PM, says Andhra CM amid criticism
üáÆüá≥ Politics & Nation.summary: Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu stated that Civil Aviation Minister K Ram Mohan Naidu is accountable to Parliament and the Prime Minister regarding the IndiGo crisis. Naidu emphasized that he does not supervise central ministers' performance, leaving it to PM Narendra Modi. He expressed confidence in Ram Mohan Naidu being guided by the Centre to resolve the issue.

üáÆüá≥ Politics & Nation.title: Delhi Jal Board 'scam': ED files chargesheet against ex-Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain, 13 others
üáÆüá≥ Politics & Nation.summary: Besides Jain, the then Water Minister of Delhi and Chairman of DJB, the prosecution complaint is filed against the then Delhi Jal Board CEO Udit Prakash Rai, former DJB member Ajay, then Delhi Jal Board Chief Engineer Satish Chandra Vashishth, and other private persons and entities under the provisions of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002.
